abstract.t: This document describes the receiver-driven RSVP-TE P2MP LSP signaling protocol (mRSVP-TE) which is an extension to the Resource Reservation Protocol - Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) for the computation and establishment of Receiver-Driven Traffic-Engineered point-to-multipoint (P2MP) and multipoint-to-multipoint (MP2MP) Label Switched Paths (LSPs) in Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) and Generalized MPLS (GMPLS) networks. The document also describes the mRSVP-TE extensions and procedures for the interworking between mRSVP-TE and the Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) protocol.
